contentList.categoryHeader: All Time Great eventsspecials Tv Shows

listItems.title: Bo Burnham: Inside
listItems.description: The musical comedy special was filmed by the comedian over the past year by himself, with no crew or audience.

listItems.title: Oprah With Meghan and Harry: A CBS Primetime Special
listItems.description: Oprah Winfrey's interview with Prince Harry and Meghan, the Duke and Duchess of Sussex includes discussions of their decision to move to the U.S. and their future.

listItems.title: A Parks and Recreation Special
listItems.description: Leslie Knope checks in with her friends while under self-isolating at home in this special episode that will raise money for Feeding America’s COVID-19 Response Fund.

listItems.title: Springsteen on Broadway
listItems.description: The Boss tells personal stories and plays acoustic versions of some of his songs in his one-man show at Broadway's Walter Kerr Theatre filmed July 17 and 18, 2018.

listItems.title: John Mulaney & The Sack Lunch Bunch: Season 1
listItems.description: The musical comedy special from John Mulaney with a group of 15 kids aged between 8 and 13-years-old are joined by Annaleigh Ashford, David Byrne, Jake Gyllenhaal, Richard Kind, Natasha Lyonne, Shereen Pimentel, and Andre De Shields.

listItems.title: 2 Dope Queens: Season 1
listItems.description: The comedy podcast with Jessica Williams and Phoebe Robinson becomes a series of TV specials with guest appearances from Uzo Aduba, Tituss Burgess, Sarah Jessica Parker, and Jon Stewart.

listItems.title: Middleditch & Schwartz
listItems.description: Three of Thomas Middleditch and Ben Schwartz's stage improv shows in New York were filmed for Netflix.

listItems.title: Between the World and Me
listItems.description: The HBO special based on the 2018 adaptation and Apollo Theater staging of Ta-Nehisi Coates' book about white supremacy in America features readings from Coates' book, animation, documentary footage and archival footage.

listItems.title: Euphoria Special Episode Part 1: Rue
listItems.description: Rue (Zendaya) talks with Ali (Colman Domingo) on Christmas Eve in the special episode of Euphoria titled Trouble Don't Last Always.

listItems.title: Sherman's Showcase Black History Month Spectacular
listItems.description: The one-hour special features Sherman McDaniels (Bashir Salahuddin) celebrating Black History Month in June.

listItems.title: Adventure Time: Distant Lands: Season 1
listItems.description: Based on the animated series Adventure Time created by Pendleton Ward, the first of four specials finds BMO (voiced by Niki Yang) crash-landing on a alien planet on the brink of destruction.

listItems.title: Gary Gulman: The Great Depresh: Season 1
listItems.description: The comedy special from Gary Gulman and filmed in Brooklyn at the Roulette Intermedium covers a variety of issues including mental health.

listItems.title: Dave Chappelle: 8:46
listItems.description: Released on the YouTube channel Netflix Is A Joke, the surprise comedy special from Dave Chappelle filmed on June 6 in Yellow Springs, Ohio features topics such as police brutality and racism.

listItems.title: The Tony Awards
listItems.description: Sara Bareilles and Josh Groban co-hosted the annual Broadway award show at Radio City Music Hall.

listItems.title: Unbreakable Kimmy Schmidt: Kimmy Vs. The Reverend
listItems.description: Kimmy Schmidt (Ellie Kemper) is getting ready to marry her Prince (Daniel Radcliffe) but she learns Reverend Richard Wayne Gary Wayne (Jon Hamm) has another group of women in a bunker. The viewer will help Kimmy decide what to do in this interactive special.

listItems.title: Euphoria Special Episode Part 2: Jules
listItems.description: The second special episode of Euphoria titled F*ck Anyone Who's Not a Sea Blob follows Jules (Hunter Schafer) during the holidays.

listItems.title: The Golden Globe Awards
listItems.description: Seth Meyers hosted the 75th Golden Globes Awards with Oprah Winfrey receiving the Cecil B. DeMille Award.

listItems.title: A West Wing Special to Benefit When We All Vote
listItems.description: The original cast (with Sterling K. Brown playing Chief of Staff Leo McGarry, originally played by the late John Spencer) will theatrical stage season three's third episode "Hartsfield's Landing" where Bartlet (Martin Sheen) deals with a standoff between China and Taiwan and plays chess with Sam (Rob Lowe) and Toby (Richard Schiff). While Josh (Bradley Whitford) waits anxiously for the results of a New Hampshire vote and C.J. (Allison Janney) hides the President's schedule from Charlie (Dulé Hill). Michelle Obama, President Bill Clinton and Lin-Manuel Miranda are expected to appear during act breaks to encourage voting.

listItems.title: Celebrating America
listItems.description: The inauguration concert special hosted by Tom Hanks features performances from such artists as Bruce Springsteen, Bon Jovi, Justin Timberlake, Ant Clemons, Tim McGraw, Tyler Hubbard, John Legend, Foo Fighters, Yo Yo Ma, Yolanda Adams, DJ Cassidy, Luis Fonsi, Ozuna, Demi Lovato, and Katy Perry as well as appearances from Lin Manuel Miranda, former Presidents George W. Bush, Bill Clinton, and Barack Obama.

listItems.title: folklore: the long pond studio sessions
listItems.description: The special directed by Taylor Swift in September 2020 in upstate New York, features Taylor, Justin Vernon, producers Jack Antonoff and Aaron Dessner performing all the tracks on her 2020 album, folklore as well as revealing behind-the-scene stories.

listItems.title: Patton Oswalt: I Love Everything
listItems.description: Filmed at Charlotte's Knight Theater, the third Netflix comedy special for the comedian includes topics like turning 50, buying a new house and finding love again.

listItems.title: Hannah Gadsby: Douglas
listItems.description: The second Netflix comedy special for the Australian comedian was recorded in Los Angeles.

listItems.title: Ellen DeGeneres: Relatable: Season 1
listItems.description: Filmed in Seattle's Benaroya Hall, Ellen DeGeneres reflects on her life and career in her first stand-up special since 2003.

listItems.title: Jerry Seinfeld: 23 Hours to Kill
listItems.description: The latest comedy special for Jerry Seinfeld was filmed at New York City's Beacon Theatre.

listItems.title: Live in Front of a Studio Audience: Norman Lear's "All in the Family" and "The Jeffersons"
listItems.description: All in the Family and its spinoff, The Jeffersons are getting a live TV staging of a classic episode from each program hosted by Normal Lear and Jimmy Kimmel. Archie Bunker will be played by Woody Harrelson, with Marisa Tomei as Edith, Ellie Kemper as Gloria, Will Ferrell as Tom, Justina Machado as Florence. While the Jeffersons cast includes Jamie Foxx as George Jefferson and Wanda Sykes as Louise.

listItems.title: Sarah Cooper: Everything's Fine
listItems.description: The comedy special from the comedian who is known for her Trump lip-sync videos features guest appearances from Fred Armisen, Jon Hamm, Megan Thee Stallion, Helen Mirren, Maya Rudolph, Winona Ryder, Ben Stiller, and Marisa Tomei.

listItems.title: ariana grande: excuse me, i love you
listItems.description: The behind-the-scenes special filmed during Ariana Grande's 2019 Sweetener World Tour in London.

listItems.title: A Very Murray Christmas
listItems.description: The Christmas special directed by Sofia Coppola and written by Coppola, Bill Murray and Mitch Glazer, is set in New York's Carlyle Hotel with Murray acting and singing in sketches with a variety of artists including Michael Cera, Miley Cyrus, George Clooney, Miley Cyrus, Rashida Jones, Jenny Lewis, Phoenix, Amy Poehler, Chris Rock, Maya Rudolph, and Jason Schwartzman.

listItems.title: Jim Gaffigan: The Pale Tourist
listItems.description: The second comedy special for the comedian on Amazon's Prime Video was filmed in Canada and Spain.

listItems.title: I'll Be Gone in the Dark Special Episode: Show Us Your Face
listItems.description: The special episode features the sentencing of the Golden State Killer, Joseph James DeAngelo in 2020 with survivors giving victim-impact statements in court. Plus some updates on the 1984 rape and murder case of Kathy Lombardo that Michelle McNamara said started her interest in true crime.

listItems.title: Friends: The Reunion
listItems.description: The cast of "Friends" return to the original soundstage where they filmed the series to reminisce and test their knowledge of the show against each other in the special that also includes appearances from David Beckham, Justin Bieber, BTS, James Corden, Cindy Crawford, Cara Delevingne, Lady Gaga, Elliott Gould, Kit Harington, Larry Hankin, Mindy Kaling, Thomas Lennon, Christina Pickles, Tom Selleck, James Michael Tyler, Maggie Wheeler, Reese Witherspoon and Malala Yousafzai.

listItems.title: The LEGO Star Wars Holiday Special
listItems.description: After the events of Star Wars: The Rise of Skywalker, while Rey's friends prepare for the Wookiee festival of Life Day, she and BB-8 end up at a Jedi temple where meets others from the past including Luke Skywalker, Darth Vader, Obi-Wan Kenobi, and Yoda.

listItems.title: Rock Center with Brian Williams: Season 1
listItems.description: Brian Williams hosts the live news magazine for NBC, which had its premiere moved up after the early cancellation of Playboy Club.

listItems.title: Live in Front of a Studio Audience: ‘All in the Family’ and ‘Good Times’: Season 1
listItems.description: Live TV stagings of a classic episode from All in the Family and Good Times. Asante Blackk, Andre Braugher, Viola Davis, Corinne Foxx, Tiffany Haddish, Jharrel Jerome, and Jay Pharoah are set as the cast for Good Times with Anthony Anderson and Patti LaBelle performing the theme song.

listItems.title: A Christmas Story Live!
listItems.description: The Tony-nominated musical (itself based on the 1983 movie) is the latest live musical for Fox and features a new song written just for this production. Adult Raphie (Matthew Broderick) recalls the Christmas when his nine-year old (Andy Walken) self wanted a Red Ryder BB, despite warnings from his mother (Maya Rudolph), his teacher (Jane Krakowski) and even Santa (David Alan Grier) who said he'd shoot his eye out.

listItems.title: Kevin Hart: Zero F**ks Given
listItems.description: The Kevin Hart stand-up special was filmed in his living room in September 2020.

listItems.title: The Golden Globe Awards
listItems.description: Ricky Gervais returns to host the 77th Golden Globes Awards with Tom Hanks receiving the Cecil B. DeMille Award.

listItems.title: Yearly Departed
listItems.description: Rachel Brosnahan, Tiffany Haddish, Patti Harrison, Natasha Leggero, Sarah Silverman, Natasha Rothwell, and Ziwe are some of the comedians giving comedic end-year goodbyes to a variety of topics in this comedy special hosted by Phoebe Robinson.

listItems.title: Coastal Elites
listItems.description: Miriam Nessler (Bette Midler), a New York teacher; Sharynn Tarrows (Kaitlyn Dever), a nurse from Wyoming; actor Mark Hesterman (Dan Levy); Youtuber Clarissa Montgomery (Sarah Paulson) and philanthropist Callie Josephson (Issa Rae) all deal with the coronavirus pandemic in different ways in this satire from Paul Rudnick.

listItems.title: The Grammy Awards
listItems.description: The annual music awards show (held at Los Angeles' Staples Center) included performances by Madonna with the Gorillaz, Mary J. Blige with U2, Kanye West with Jamie Foxx, and a rare appearance by Sly Stone.

listItems.title: The Maya Rudolph Show: Season 1
listItems.description: Maya Rudolph hosts a variety show with guest appearances from Fred Armisen, Kristen Bell, Sean Hayes, Janelle Monáe, and Andy Samberg.

listItems.title: The Tony Awards
listItems.description: Kevin Spacey hosted the annual Broadway award show at Radio City Music Hall.

listItems.title: The Sound of Music Live!
listItems.description: Carrie Underwood is Maria in this live adaptation of the original  Broadway musical The Sound of Music that includes Stephen Moyer as Captain von Trapp as well as Broadway veterans Audra McDonald as Mother Abbes, Laura Benanti as Elsa, and Christian Borle as Max.

listItems.title: Pete Davidson: Alive From New York
listItems.description: The stand-up special from the Saturday Night Live cast member was recorded at New York's Gramercy Theater.

listItems.title: The Little Mermaid Live!: Season 1
listItems.description: ABC's live musical adaptation of The Little Mermaid will feature Auli'i Cravalho as Ariel, Queen Latifah as Ursula and Shaggy as Sebastian.

listItems.title: 30 Rock: A One-Time Special
listItems.description: The 30 Rock reunion is part of an Upfront special that will introduce some of the upcoming series on the various NBCUniversal networks. Some local NBC affiliates will preempt it due to fear it is little more than an infomercial for Peacock (who will stream the special the next day).

listItems.title: Rent (2019)
listItems.description: Jonathan Larson's award-winning musical re-imagining of Puccini's "La Bohème" set in New York City is the latest show to become a live TV musical for Fox.

listItems.title: Maya & Marty: Season 1
listItems.description: The variety show hosted by Maya Rudolph and Martin short will be aired live from Studio 6A in Rockefeller Center.

listItems.title: The Tony Awards
listItems.description: James Corden hosted the annual Broadway award show at Radio City Music Hall.

listItems.title: School Pride: Season 1
listItems.description: Tom Stroup, Kym Whitley, Jacob Soboroff, and Susie Castillo work together with volunteers to help renovate and transform some public schools across America.

listItems.title: Best Time Ever with Neil Patrick Harris: Season 1
listItems.description: Neil Patrick Harris host this live variety show based on the British show Ant & Dec’s Saturday Night Takeaway.

listItems.title: The Grammy Awards
listItems.description: The annual music awards show (held again at Los Angeles' Staples Center) was highlighted by only the second performance by a reunited Police in 25 years. The Dixie Chicks and Mary J. Blige were among the night's biggest winners.

listItems.title: Death To 2020
listItems.description: The Charlie Brooker mockumentary features commentary about the year 2020 from fictional experts, world leaders and everyday people including a reporter (Samuel L. Jackson), historian (Hugh Grant), a doctor (Leslie Jones), a politician (Lisa Kudrow), a scientist (Samson Kayo), a tech executive (Kumail Nanjiani), an average citizen (Diane Morgan), and the Queen (Tracey Ullman).

listItems.title: The Passion
listItems.description: Tyler Perry hosts and narrates the live musical in New Orleans about Jesus' last hours.

listItems.title: The Golden Globe Awards
listItems.description: The COVID-19 delayed Golden Globe was hosted by Tina Fey in New York and by Amy Poehler in Los Angeles.

listItems.title: Dr. Seuss' The Grinch Musical!
listItems.description: The Grinch (Matthew Morrison) plans to steal Christmas in this musical based on the Dr. Seuss' book filmed at London's Troubadour Theatre.
